    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultDisplay

        public android.view.Display getDefaultDisplay()
        Description copied from interface: android.view.WindowManager
        Returns the Display upon which this WindowManager instance will create new windows.

        Despite the name of this method, the display that is returned is not necessarily the primary display of the system (see Display.DEFAULT_DISPLAY). The returned display could instead be a secondary display that this window manager instance is managing. Think of it as the display that this WindowManager instance uses by default.

        To create windows on a different display, you need to obtain a WindowManager for that Display. (See the WindowManager class documentation for more information.)

        Specified by:
        getDefaultDisplay in interface android.view.WindowManager
        Returns:
        The display that this window manager is managing.

      • addView

        public void addView(android.view.View arg0,
                    android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams arg1)
        Description copied from interface: android.view.ViewManager
        Assign the passed LayoutParams to the passed View and add the view to the window.

        Throws WindowManager.BadTokenException for certain programming errors, such as adding a second view to a window without removing the first view.

        Throws WindowManager.InvalidDisplayException if the window is on a secondary Display and the specified display can't be found (see Presentation).

        Specified by:
        addView in interface android.view.ViewManager
        Parameters:
        arg0 - The view to be added to this window.
        arg1 - The LayoutParams to assign to view.

      • removeView

        public void removeView(android.view.View arg0)
        Specified by:
        removeView in interface android.view.ViewManager

      • updateViewLayout

        public void updateViewLayout(android.view.View arg0,
                             android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams arg1)
        Specified by:
        updateViewLayout in interface android.view.ViewManager

      • removeViewImmediate

        public void removeViewImmediate(android.view.View arg0)
        Description copied from interface: android.view.WindowManager
        Special variation of ViewManager.removeView(android.view.View) that immediately invokes the given view hierarchy's View.onDetachedFromWindow() methods before returning. This is not for normal applications; using it correctly requires great care.
        Specified by:
        removeViewImmediate in interface android.view.WindowManager
        Parameters:
        arg0 - The view to be removed.
